 They work across web, mobile, WhatsApp, Telegram, SMS, and enterprise systems—supporting text, audio, and image interactions. By automating routine queries, escalating complex cases, and providing real-time analytics, they ensure 24/7 availability, lower costs, and stronger customer relationships.

industryCard.title: Retail & E-Commerce

From consumer apps to marketplace and delivery platforms, our technology helps businesses improve efficiency, prevent disruptions, and deliver seamless, engaging customer journeys at scale.

From smart sensors and automated monitoring to AI-enabled yield forecasting and farm management, our solutions help farmers and agribusinesses make better decisions, reduce waste, and build resilient, future-ready operations.

about_section.title: Drive Innovation with a Partner You can Trust

As a global technology partner, we empower organizations across North America, the UK, and the Middle East with AI-powered solutions across diverse platforms. With a team averaging over 10 years of experience—including top AI specialists and DevOps architects—we bring precision to projects ranging from safety-critical systems to scalable enterprise platforms. With globally connected teams, we combine technical mastery with a client-first approach, delivering technology that solves complex challenges while driving growth. Turning ideas into intelligent digital realities—let’s build what’s next, together.

case_studies_hero.title: Case Studies
case_studies_hero.description: Discover how our technology solutions have propelled businesses to new heights. Through collaboration, innovation, and a tailored approach, we’ve helped our clients overcome complex challenges, streamline operations, and unlock new opportunities for growth.

case_study_cards.title: AI-Powered Multimodal & Multilingual Chatbot
case_study_cards.description: In today's fast-paced digital landscape, organizations face immense pressure to deliver instant, accurate, and scalable customer support across multiple channels. Traditional human-centric service models often struggle with 24/7 availability, high operational costs, and the inefficiency of repetitive tasks. This project addressed the critical need for an intelligent, automated solution that could offload routine inquiries, enhance service accessibility, and empower human agents to focus on complex, high-value interactions.
case_study_cards.content:
Client challenge

Organizations faced significant challenges in managing high volumes of customer inquiries, leading to overwhelmed human agents and inconsistent service delivery. The reliance on manual processes limited scalability and prevented 24/7 customer support, impacting user satisfaction and operational efficiency. Existing knowledge was often fragmented within WhatsApp chat messages, making it difficult to provide standardized and timely responses.

Solution

We developed a multi-modal, multilingual (99+ languages) WhatsApp chatbot that automates customer interactions across text, audio, and image formats. We leveraged AI based intent recognition to categorize user's query and a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline to prepare most accurate response based on private organizational data. Our solution also includes intelligent human escalation for complex queries, ensuring seamless service continuity.

Benefits

  • Enabled 24/7 automated customer support in their native language.
  • Significantly reduced human agent workload.
  • Provided scalable handling of high query volumes.
  • Ensured consistent and standardized information delivery.

In today's fast-paced digital landscape, organizations face immense pressure to deliver instant, accurate, and scalable customer support across multiple channels. Traditional human-centric service models often struggle with 24/7 availability, high operational costs, and the inefficiency of repetitive tasks. This project addressed the critical need for an intelligent, automated solution that could offload routine inquiries, enhance service accessibility, and empower human agents to focus on complex, high-value interactions.

Background

The client, exemplified by an accountancy firm, faced challenges in providing consistent information on courses, fees, and payment processes. Their existing knowledge base was primarily embedded within human agent chat logs, making it difficult to centralize and leverage for automated responses. This fragmented knowledge hindered efficient information retrieval and dissemination.

Human agents worked in shifts, leading to limited availability and inconsistent service delivery. The firm needed a system that could handle diverse query types—text, audio, and images—and accurately distinguish between general chat, irrelevant messages, and specific organizational data queries. A significant hurdle was the inability of automated systems to verify sensitive actions like payment confirmations, necessitating a robust human escalation process.

End-users required immediate and accurate answers to their queries, expecting seamless interactions across various communication modes. Human agents were burdened with repetitive tasks and the manual effort of extracting and sharing knowledge. The organization sought a solution to improve efficiency, reduce operational costs, and enhance overall customer satisfaction by automating routine interactions.

Executive Summary

The solution implemented a multi-modal, multilingual WhatsApp chatbot designed to automate customer service interactions. It leverages advanced intent recognition and a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline to provide precise answers from private organizational data, seamlessly escalating complex queries to human agents. The system offers flexible knowledge base onboarding, including learning from existing chat histories and integrating with document repositories. This has resulted in enhanced 24/7 availability, significant scalability improvements, and a reduction in the repetitive workload for human support teams.

Key Business Challenges

  • High operational costs associated with maintaining a large human agent workforce for routine inquiries.
  • Limited scalability of human-operated service centers, leading to delays during peak demand.
  • Inconsistent customer experiences due to varying agent knowledge and availability across shifts.
  • Inefficient knowledge management, with critical organizational data fragmented across chat logs and diverse documents.
  • Inability to provide 24/7 customer support, impacting global reach and user satisfaction.
  • Manual and time-consuming processes for updating and disseminating new organizational information.

Solution Overview

The solution is a multi-modal, multilingual WhatsApp chatbot, supporting text, audio, and image inputs and outputs. It employs a sophisticated intent recognition engine to categorize user queries, distinguishing between general chat, irrelevant messages, and specific organizational data requests. For relevant queries, it activates a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline.

The RAG pipeline converts private organizational data into Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) and stores them in a Milvus vector database. For the user's query related to organizational data, the system performs a semantic search to retrieve top-matching answers. A similarity score threshold determines the quality of the match; if below the threshold, or if the user explicitly requests it, the query is seamlessly escalated to a human agent.

Knowledge base onboarding is highly flexible. Organizations can upload documents (PDF, Excel, PowerPoint, Word) for automatic conversion into FAQs. Alternatively, for existing service channels, the chatbot can either retrieve last 6 months of chat history (if available), or listen to human agent interactions over approximately one month to absorb and convert chat histories into a structured knowledge base.

The backend utilizes a microservice architecture, with offline, production-grade LLM deployment powered by vLLM for low latency, scalability, and data privacy. Minio or S3 is used for object storage of user-sent images and voice notes. The platform also offers multi-model support, integrating with OpenAI, Gemini, Grok, and locally hosted models. An administrative portal provides comprehensive analytics, including user statistics, chat durations, demographics, and topic popularity, enabling continuous improvement of the knowledge base. The system also integrates with Google Sheets and other interfaces for scheduled or on-demand updates to the organizational knowledge base, ensuring information remains current.

Outcomes and Impact

  • 24/7 Availability: The chatbot provides continuous, round-the-clock customer support, eliminating time zone limitations.
  • Enhanced Scalability: Capable of handling thousands of concurrent users, significantly exceeding human agent capacity.
  • Reduced Operational Costs: Automates repetitive inquiries, freeing human agents to focus on complex, high-value tasks.
  • Improved Data Access: Centralized knowledge base ensures quick and consistent access to organizational information.
  • Data-Driven Optimization: Admin dashboard provides detailed analytics on user satisfaction and query trends, guiding knowledge base enhancements.
  • Flexible Knowledge Management: Seamless integration for document-based or chat-history-based knowledge onboarding and updates.
  • Multi-modal User Experience: Supports text, audio, and image interactions, catering to diverse user preferences.
  • Secure Data Handling: Offline LLM deployment and private vector database (Milvus) ensure data privacy and security.
  • Pilot Results: An accountancy firm successfully deployed the chatbot to answer course fees and payment guidance, with payment verification efficiently escalated to human agents.

case_study_cards.title: Secure, Multilingual Conversations with Sensitive Documents
case_study_cards.description: Organizations face significant challenges in transforming vast, unstructured data into actionable intelligence. The need for secure, efficient, and accurate information retrieval from internal knowledge bases is paramount for informed decision-making, regulatory compliance, and operational efficiency. This project addressed the critical demand for a system that can intelligently process diverse data formats while maintaining strict data privacy and providing verifiable insights.
case_study_cards.content:
Client challenge

Organizations struggled to efficiently process, extract, and query information from a diverse range of unstructured documents and online sources. The lack of a unified system hindered quick access to critical data and the ability to generate precise, cited answers, especially for complex formats like PDFs, multi-sheet Excel files and scanned documents.

Solution

Organizations face significant challenges in transforming vast, unstructured data into actionable intelligence. The need for secure, efficient, and accurate information retrieval from internal knowledge bases is paramount for informed decision-making, regulatory compliance, and operational efficiency. This project addressed the critical demand for a system that can intelligently process diverse data formats while maintaining strict data privacy and providing verifiable insights.

Benefits

  • Offline deployment options ensure enhanced data privacy and control.
  • Accurate Q&A with page-level and exact location citations.
  • Support for complex document types, including Excel and scanned images.
  • Multilingual web interface for broader user accessibility.

Organizations face significant challenges in transforming vast, unstructured data into actionable intelligence. The need for secure, efficient, and accurate information retrieval from internal knowledge bases is paramount for informed decision-making, regulatory compliance, and operational efficiency. This project addressed the critical demand for a system that can intelligently process diverse data formats while maintaining strict data privacy and providing verifiable insights.

Background

The client operates in an environment rich with diverse digital content, including PDFs, Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, Markdown, plain text files, and online resources. Extracting specific, accurate information from this fragmented data landscape was a significant hurdle. Traditional search methods often failed to provide precise answers or context, leading to time-consuming manual data retrieval.

A key challenge involved processing complex document structures, such as multi-sheet Excel files, where data needed to be extracted, structured, and made queryable. Similarly, scanned documents and images required advanced processing to extract text and integrate it into the knowledge base. The client also prioritized data privacy, necessitating solutions that could operate securely, potentially on-premises, without compromising sensitive information.

Stakeholders, from individual users needing quick answers to administrators managing user access and data, required a system that was intuitive, scalable, and reliable. The existing infrastructure lacked the capability to handle simultaneous processing tasks efficiently or to offer granular control over user features and document limits.

Executive Summary

Our solution implemented a sophisticated RAG pipeline to transform diverse unstructured data into a queryable knowledge base. Leveraging a microservice architecture, files are processed through dedicated pipelines, stored in object storage (AWS S3 or MinIO), and indexed in a Milvus vector database. To ensure scalability, low latency, and complete data privacy, we incorporated offline, production-grade LLM deployment using vLLM, enabling high-throughput inference without relying on external APIs. This system empowers users to ask natural language questions and receive precise, cited answers, significantly enhancing information access and data utilization across the organization.

Key Business Challenges

  • Difficulty in extracting structured data from complex documents like multi-sheet Excel files, leading to manual effort and potential errors in analysis.
  • Lack of a unified system to query information across diverse document formats and online resources, hindering efficient knowledge retrieval and decision-making.
  • Inability to provide precise, cited answers to user queries, impacting trust in information and requiring manual verification processes.
  • Concerns regarding data privacy and security, necessitating options for on-premises deployment and offline functionality to meet compliance requirements.

Solution Overview

The solution is built on a microservice architecture with dedicated data processing pipelines. When a user uploads a document, it is stored in object storage, and its metadata—including file name, type, and user association—is recorded in a central database for tracking. A processing job is then created and pushed to a message queue (e.g., RabbitMQ, Apache Kafka, or AWS SQS), which distributes tasks across processing services. Based on resource availability, jobs are dynamically scheduled and executed, enabling scalable, fault-tolerant, and parallel processing of files while ensuring high availability and efficient resource utilization.

The system supports a wide array of document formats, including PDF, DOC/DOCX, Markdown, TXT, XLS/XLSX, and images, as well as online resources such as websites and Google Docs. Each format is handled through a dedicated parsing pipeline. For instance, with Excel files, data is extracted from every sheet, converted into a structured format, and stored in the database. The processed and structured data is then embedded into a Milvus vector database for fast, semantic querying.

To ensure low latency, scalability, and complete data privacy, the platform uses offline, production-grade LLM deployment powered by vLLM, enabling high-throughput inference without relying on third-party APIs. Users can query one or multiple documents and receive precise, cited answers with page numbers and exact content locations. The system further enhances the user experience with clickable references, read-aloud functionality, and answer regeneration. It also provides multi-model support, allowing seamless integration with OpenAI, Gemini, Grok, and locally hosted models to offer flexible and diverse AI capabilities. This architecture provides the flexibility for both cloud-hosted and on-premises deployments, meeting diverse enterprise data privacy and regulatory compliance needs.

Outcomes and Impact

  • Enabled Natural Language Querying: Enabled natural language querying across diverse document types, including complex Excel sheets and scanned documents.
  • Delivered Precise Citations: Delivered precise, page-level citations for answers, enhancing trust and verifiability of information.
  • Supported Flexible Deployment: Supported flexible deployment options—including cloud, on-premises, and offline production-grade LLM deployment using vLLM—to meet diverse data privacy and control requirements.
  • Integrated Multiple AI Models: Integrated multiple AI models (OpenAI, Gemini, Grok, and locally hosted models), providing flexibility and future-proofing for advanced capabilities.
  • Streamlined Information Access: Streamlined information access and knowledge retrieval from private data sources, significantly reducing manual effort and improving efficiency.

case_study_cards.title: AI-Powered Meeting Intelligence Platform
case_study_cards.description: In fast-paced startup environments, efficient communication and accurate documentation are paramount for successful product development. The inherent challenges of small teams and rapid iteration often lead to critical information being lost, hindering progress and increasing development costs. This creates a significant barrier to maintaining product integrity and accelerating time-to-market. Our solution addresses the urgent need for a systematic approach to capture and disseminate vital meeting intelligence, ensuring all stakeholders remain aligned and informed throughout the product lifecycle.
case_study_cards.content:
## Executive Summary
The AI-Powered Meeting Intelligence Platform is a comprehensive solution that automatically transcribes, analyzes, and extracts valuable insights from meeting recordings. By leveraging advanced natural language processing and intent recognition technology, the platform transforms unstructured meeting content into organized, actionable outputs including meeting minutes, summaries, requirements documentation, and follow-up tasks. Designed for individual professionals, small teams, and growing organizations, this solution eliminates manual meeting documentation overhead while ensuring critical information is captured and distributed efficiently.

---

## Challenges

Organizations across industries struggle with several recurring challenges in meeting management:

**Information Loss:** Critical decisions, action items, and requirements discussed in meetings are often lost or poorly documented, leading to miscommunication and project delays.

**Manual Documentation Overhead:** Traditional meeting documentation requires dedicated personnel to attend meetings solely for note-taking, consuming valuable resources and creating bottlenecks.

**Inconsistent Documentation Standards:** Different team members produce varying quality and format of meeting records, making it difficult to maintain organizational knowledge consistency.

**Time-Consuming Follow-ups:** Converting meeting discussions into actionable items like requirements documents, task lists, or project summaries requires significant post-meeting effort.

**Limited Accessibility:** Meeting insights remain trapped in recordings or scattered notes, making them difficult to search, reference, or share with stakeholders who couldn't attend.

---
## Solution
The AI-Powered Meeting Intelligence Platform addresses these challenges through a four-tier approach that combines automation with user flexibility:
### Core Features
#### Automated Transcription & Analysis
- High-accuracy speech-to-text conversion for meeting recordings
- Multi-language support with specialized handling for regional dialects
- Automatic speaker identification and timeline mapping

#### Intelligent Content Extraction
- Standardized meeting minutes generation with agenda tracking
- Professional meeting summaries with key decision points
- Automated action item identification and assignment tracking
#### Intent-Based Smart Suggestions
- AI-powered analysis of meeting content to identify discussion themes
- Dynamic generation of relevant output options based on meeting context
- Top 3-5 intent-based suggestions with expandable options for comprehensive coverage
#### Flexible Output Generation
- Fixed templates for standard outputs (meeting minutes, summaries)
- Intent-recognition driven suggestions for specialized needs (requirements documentation, idea lists, project plans)
- Exhaustive option library covering 40-50 different output formats
- Custom prompt capability for unique organizational needs
#### Knowledge Management Integration
- Hierarchical folder structure for organized storage
- Multi-meeting analysis capability for combined insights
- Tagging and categorization system for easy retrieval
#### Export & Distribution
- Multiple format support (Word, PDF, plain text)
- Direct email integration for stakeholder distribution
- Seamless sharing capabilities across team collaboration tools
---
## Example Applications
**Project Management Teams:** Automatically convert project discussion recordings into structured requirements documents, task assignments, and milestone tracking reports.

**Product Development:** Transform feature planning sessions into comprehensive product roadmaps, user story documentation, and development task breakdowns.

**Client Consultation:** Generate professional client meeting summaries, proposal outlines, and follow-up action plans for improved customer relationship management.

**Strategic Planning:** Consolidate multiple planning session recordings into unified strategic documents, decision logs, and implementation roadmaps.
## Business Impact
### Operational Efficiency
- **75% reduction** in manual documentation time, allowing team members to focus on core responsibilities rather than note-taking
- **Immediate availability** of meeting outputs, eliminating delays in decision implementation and task assignment
### Cost Optimization
- **Eliminates dedicated note-taker roles:** A typical organization spending $40,000 annually on part-time documentation support can redirect these resources to higher-value activities
- **Reduces meeting overhead:** 30-50% decrease in time spent clarifying missed points or searching for previous discussion details
### Quality & Consistency
- **Standardized documentation formats** ensure consistent quality across all organizational meetings
- **Comprehensive capture** eliminates information loss common in manual note-taking processes
- **Searchable knowledge** base improves organizational memory and decision traceability
### Scalability & Accessibility
- **Handles unlimited concurrent meetings** without additional resource allocation
- **Mobile-first design** enables on-the-go meeting management and review
- **Multi-user collaboration** supports team-based review and editing of generated content
### Decision Making Enhancement
- **Faster implementation cycles** through immediate availability of action items and requirements
- **Improved accountability** with clear assignment tracking and follow-up mechanisms
- **Better stakeholder alignment** through consistent communication of meeting outcomes
---

## Conclusion
The AI-Powered Meeting Intelligence Platform represents a fundamental shift from reactive meeting documentation to proactive meeting intelligence. By combining advanced AI capabilities with intuitive user experience, the solution delivers immediate operational benefits while building long-term organizational knowledge assets.

The platform's flexible architecture scales seamlessly from individual professionals managing personal meetings to small teams coordinating complex projects. Its intent-based suggestion system ensures that users receive relevant, actionable outputs without being overwhelmed by unnecessary features.

The platform's flexible architecture scales seamlessly from individual professionals managing personal meetings to small teams coordinating complex projects. Its intent-based suggestion system ensures that users receive relevant, actionable outputs without being overwhelmed by unnecessary features.
### Key Differentiators:
- Four-tier flexibility system accommodating diverse organizational needs
- Intent-recognition technology that learns and adapts to user patterns
- Comprehensive export and integration capabilities
Mobile-optimized experience for modern workforce requirements
- Scalable architecture supporting growth from individual to enterprise use

case_study_cards.title: Track, Audit & Optimize with Confidence
case_study_cards.description: The increasing scale and complexity of infrastructure projects across the Middle East, Europe, and Australia demand advanced asset management solutions. With thousands of kilometers of assets spanning diverse and often remote environments, organizations require systems that ensure operational continuity, enhance safety, and drive cost efficiencies. The urgency to modernize legacy systems and adapt to stringent regulatory landscapes underscores the critical need for integrated, mobile-first platforms capable of handling complex data and workflows, especially where connectivity is unreliable.
case_study_cards.content:
Client challenge

Operators across the Middle East's oil and gas, Europe's construction, and Australia's electric utility sectors faced significant challenges managing vast linear and point infrastructure. Fragmented data, manual inspection processes, and a lack of real-time, offline-capable field tools hindered operational efficiency and safety compliance. This led to delayed maintenance, increased costs, and limited visibility into critical asset conditions across arduous terrains.

Our Solution

The increasing scale and complexity of infrastructure projects across the Middle East, Europe, and Australia demand advanced asset management solutions. With thousands of kilometers of assets spanning diverse and often remote environments, organizations require systems that ensure operational continuity, enhance safety, and drive cost efficiencies. The urgency to modernize legacy systems and adapt to stringent regulatory landscapes underscores the critical need for integrated, mobile-first platforms capable of handling complex data and workflows, especially where connectivity is unreliable.

Key Benefits

  • Reduced operational costs through predictive maintenance and streamlined workflows.
  • Enhanced safety and compliance with enforced protocols and real-time monitoring.
  • Improved asset visibility and data accuracy across diverse infrastructure networks.
  • Faster response times for critical maintenance and defect resolution.

The increasing scale and complexity of infrastructure projects across the Middle East, Europe, and Australia demand advanced asset management solutions. With thousands of kilometers of assets spanning diverse and often remote environments, organizations require systems that ensure operational continuity, enhance safety, and drive cost efficiencies. The urgency to modernize legacy systems and adapt to stringent regulatory landscapes underscores the critical need for integrated, mobile-first platforms capable of handling complex data and workflows, especially where connectivity is unreliable.

Background

Organizations managing critical infrastructure in the Middle East's oil & gas sector, Europe's construction, and Australia's electric utility sectors face unique operational environments. These include vast, remote locations with limited or no connectivity, requiring robust solutions for field operations.

A significant challenge stems from managing extensive legacy networks, often spanning thousands of kilometers, which lack comprehensive digital records and predictive maintenance capabilities. This leads to fragmented data, outdated information, and technical blockages in implementing modern asset management strategies.

Stakeholders, including field engineers, maintenance crews, and regulatory bodies, require immediate, accurate access to asset information and the ability to report issues from any location. The difficulty of managing hundreds or thousands of different complex forms and reports for each asset further complicates compliance and operational efficiency, demanding a flexible and adaptable system.

Our system provides a unified digital solution for managing critical linear and point infrastructure assets across diverse sectors. It leverages mobile-native applications with essential offline capabilities and intelligent monitoring to streamline field operations, enhance data accuracy, and ensure regulatory compliance. This implementation has delivered significant improvements in operational efficiency, safety, and cost management, enabling organizations to confidently track, audit, and optimize their infrastructure.

Key Business Challenges

  • Fragmented Asset Data: Legacy systems and manual processes resulted in inconsistent and outdated records for thousands of kilometers of assets, hindering effective maintenance planning and regulatory reporting.
  • Limited Connectivity in Arduous Terrains: Field operations in remote areas, such as desert environments in the Middle East or vast construction sites in Europe, suffered from unreliable network access, preventing real-time data capture and communication.
  • Complex Form Management: The need to manage hundreds or thousands of different, complex forms and reports for various assets and regulatory requirements created significant administrative burden and potential for errors.
  • Ensuring Workforce Safety: Monitoring and enforcing safety protocols, including hours-of-service tracking, was challenging in harsh environments, impacting compliance and operational risk.
  • Integration with Legacy Systems: Existing enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems lacked mobile-native capabilities and required extensive customization for field use, creating operational silos.
  • Reactive Maintenance: The absence of comprehensive asset records and predictive insights led to reactive maintenance strategies, increasing emergency repairs and operational downtime.

Solution Overview

Our Smart Asset Inspection, Maintenance, and Scheduling System offers a unified solution for comprehensive management of both linear assets (e.g., pipelines, transmission lines, roads) and associated point assets (e.g., pumping stations, substations, bridges) within a single, integrated system.

The solution features a robust mobile-first architecture, providing fully functional native applications for inspection, maintenance, and reporting. A key differentiator is its critical offline operation capability, allowing field teams to work completely without connectivity in arduous terrains, with seamless background synchronization once network access is restored.

Our approach involved close collaboration with client stakeholders to understand their specific needs, including the rapid development of custom forms and reports. This enabled quick turnover based on client requirements, addressing the challenge of managing hundreds or thousands of different complex forms instantly.

The platform integrates intelligent defect management, combining automated detection with manual reporting, and utilizes geographic positioning for precise, location-based maintenance planning. Rollout included comprehensive workshops and testing, ensuring user adoption and ongoing maintenance support.

Outcomes and Impact

  • Enhanced Operational Efficiency: Streamlined inspection processes through real-time mobile data capture, eliminating paperwork and accelerating work order generation by [Not provided] percent.
  • Improved Data Accuracy and Access: Digital records replaced fragmented documentation, providing enhanced asset visibility and faster access to critical information across all regions.
  • Significant Cost Reductions: Predictive maintenance strategies reduced emergency repairs and downtime by [Not provided] percent, while automation lowered administrative overhead.
  • Strengthened Safety and Compliance: Enforced safety protocols via pre-inspection checklists and hours-of-service monitoring, leading to a [Not provided] percent improvement in safety incident rates.
  • Uninterrupted Field Operations: Robust offline capabilities ensured continuous work in remote and arduous terrains, with seamless data synchronization upon connectivity restoration.
  • Rapid Form Customization: The system enabled instant creation and deployment of complex forms and reports, adapting quickly to diverse asset types and regulatory requirements.
  • Scalability and Reliability: The cloud-native architecture supports thousands of users and integrates seamlessly with existing enterprise systems, ensuring high availability and future growth.

case_study_cards.title: AI-Powered Grading & Tutoring
case_study_cards.description: The education sector faces increasing demands for personalized learning and efficient assessment. This project aimed to leverage AI to address these challenges, enhancing both educator productivity and student engagement. By automating repetitive tasks and providing tailored support, the solution sought to transform traditional learning and evaluation processes, making education more accessible and effective at scale.
case_study_cards.content:
Client challenge

Educators faced significant challenges with the time-consuming and often inconsistent manual grading of diverse question types, hindering their ability to provide timely and personalized feedback to students. The lack of efficient tools for generating tailored practice questions and offering on-demand tutoring further limited student learning and development. This created a bottleneck in educational processes, impacting both teacher productivity and student engagement.

Solution

The education sector faces increasing demands for personalized learning and efficient assessment. This project aimed to leverage AI to address these challenges, enhancing both educator productivity and student engagement. By automating repetitive tasks and providing tailored support, the solution sought to transform traditional learning and evaluation processes, making education more accessible and effective at scale.

Benefits

  • Reduced teacher workload by automating diverse grading tasks.
  • Provided consistent and justified feedback to students.
  • Enabled personalized practice question generation based on performance.
  • Offered 24/7 AI-powered tutoring support across subjects.

The education sector faces increasing demands for personalized learning and efficient assessment. This project aimed to leverage AI to address these challenges, enhancing both educator productivity and student engagement. By automating repetitive tasks and providing tailored support, the solution sought to transform traditional learning and evaluation processes, making education more accessible and effective at scale.

Background

The education industry often struggles with the labor-intensive and subjective nature of grading, leading to teacher burnout and inconsistent student feedback. Traditional methods also lack the agility to provide personalized learning paths or on-demand tutoring. These issues are compounded by the need to support various question formats, from short answers to complex essays and mathematical problems, across digital and scanned inputs.

Existing systems frequently fail to offer detailed justifications for marks, leaving students without clear guidance on areas for improvement. Furthermore, the manual creation of tailored practice materials for individual student needs is time-consuming and difficult to scale. Stakeholders, including educators, students, and institutions, required a scalable solution to streamline assessment, offer targeted support, and improve overall learning outcomes.

Executive Summary

The solution delivered an AI-driven platform encompassing auto-grading, personalized feedback, dynamic practice question generation, and an interactive tutoring chatbot. This comprehensive suite was implemented to automate assessment processes, provide detailed justifications for marks, and offer on-demand educational support. The system demonstrated grading consistency comparable to human evaluators, significantly reducing administrative burden for educators and enhancing the learning experience for students.

Key Business Challenges

  • Inefficient Manual Grading: Educators spent significant time on grading, diverting focus from teaching and student interaction.
  • Inconsistent Evaluation: Subjectivity in human grading led to variations in scores and feedback across different evaluators.
  • Lack of Personalized Feedback: Students often received generic feedback, hindering their understanding of specific areas for improvement.
  • Limited Practice Opportunities: Generating tailored practice questions for individual student needs was time-consuming and difficult.
  • Scalability Issues: Traditional tutoring and assessment methods struggled to scale to large student populations.

Solution Overview

The solution is an AI-based suite of applications designed for the Art Tech field, offering auto-grading, a tutoring chatbot, lesson planning, and practice tests. The auto-grading system supports various question types (short, long, mathematical, essay) and input formats (digital, scanned). It generates marking rubrics from natural language descriptions or existing human-graded papers, allowing instructors to refine them.

The platform ensures low latency, scalability, and complete data privacy through offline, production-grade LLM deployment powered by vLLM. This enables high-throughput inference without relying on third-party APIs. It also provides multi-model support, allowing seamless integration with OpenAI, Gemini, Grok, and locally hosted models to offer flexible and diverse AI capabilities.

The tutoring chatbot functions as a teacher assistant, answering subject-related questions via various messaging channels (WhatsApp, Telegram, SMS, Web) and providing personalized explanations based on the student's skill level. This AI-based system receives questions, evaluates them, and offers detailed explanations, making it a valuable tool in the educational domain. Additionally, the system can generate practice questions in specific subjects and difficulty levels based on student performance, which are then auto-graded.

Outcomes and Impact

  • Reduced Teacher Workload: Significantly decreased time spent on grading, allowing educators to focus on teaching and student interaction.
  • Consistent Grading: Achieved grading variations well within the range of human evaluators across multiple subjects.
  • Personalized Feedback: Provided detailed justifications for marks awarded or deducted, along with actionable improvement suggestions.
  • Enhanced Learning: Enabled on-demand generation of personalized practice questions based on student performance and selected difficulty levels.
  • 24/7 Tutoring Support: Offered scalable, AI-powered assistance for students across diverse subjects, improving access to help.
  • Data Privacy & Scalability: Ensured secure and high-throughput inference without reliance on third-party APIs, supporting large-scale deployment.

case_study_cards.title: Vision Intelligence and Automation Platform
case_study_cards.description: In an era demanding heightened security and operational efficiency, organizations require robust solutions to manage physical access and monitor restricted areas. This project addressed the critical need for an intelligent system that not only automates routine tasks like attendance but also proactively identifies and alerts on security breaches, providing valuable insights into facility usage and personnel movement. The ability to configure zones for specific purposes—from attendance to high-security restrictions—underscores the system's versatility and strategic importance in modern facility management.
case_study_cards.content:
Client challenge

The client faced significant challenges in manually monitoring premises for security and attendance, leading to inefficiencies and potential security gaps. They required an automated, real-time system to track personnel movement, enforce access rules, and provide actionable insights from video feeds. This manual approach was prone to errors and lacked the immediate response capabilities needed for modern security and operational demands.

Solution

In an era demanding heightened security and operational efficiency, organizations require robust solutions to manage physical access and monitor restricted areas. This project addressed the critical need for an intelligent system that not only automates routine tasks like attendance but also proactively identifies and alerts on security breaches, providing valuable insights into facility usage and personnel movement. The ability to configure zones for specific purposes—from attendance to high-security restrictions—underscores the system's versatility and strategic importance in modern facility management.

Benefits

  • Automated real-time attendance logging and reporting.
  • Enhanced security through instant alerts for unauthorized access.
  • Flexible configuration of zones for diverse operational needs.
  • Reduced manual monitoring effort and associated costs.

In an era demanding heightened security and operational efficiency, organizations require robust solutions to manage physical access and monitor restricted areas. This project addressed the critical need for an intelligent system that not only automates routine tasks like attendance but also proactively identifies and alerts on security breaches, providing valuable insights into facility usage and personnel movement. The ability to configure zones for specific purposes—from attendance to high-security restrictions—underscores the system's versatility and strategic importance in modern facility management.

Background

Organizations often struggle with outdated or manual methods for managing physical access, tracking employee attendance, and securing restricted zones. These methods are prone to human error, time-consuming, and lack the real-time intelligence needed to respond effectively to security incidents. The client sought a modern solution to overcome these limitations, aiming for a system that could seamlessly integrate with existing camera infrastructure and provide actionable insights.

The detailed challenges included the inability to automatically differentiate between authorized and unauthorized personnel, the lack of real-time alerts for security breaches, and the administrative burden of manual attendance tracking. Furthermore, there was a need for a system that could track unknown individuals and maintain historical data on their movements within designated areas.

Key stakeholders included security personnel responsible for safeguarding premises, HR departments managing employee attendance, and facility managers overseeing operational efficiency and compliance. All required a unified, intelligent system to streamline operations and enhance overall security posture.

Executive Summary

The solution delivered an advanced AI-driven video analytics platform capable of real-time person detection, identification, and tracking. Implemented through a configurable web dashboard, the system automates access control, attendance marking, and trespassing detection. This has resulted in improved operational efficiency, enhanced security posture, and comprehensive data for facility management and security analysis.

Key Business Challenges

  • Manual attendance tracking led to inaccuracies and significant administrative overhead.
  • Lack of real-time alerts for unauthorized entry compromised security in restricted areas.
  • Inefficient monitoring of large premises required extensive human resources.
  • Difficulty in differentiating between authorized personnel and unknown individuals.
  • Absence of historical data on movement patterns hindered security analysis and operational planning.
  • Existing systems lacked the flexibility to define and manage different types of zones (e.g., attendance, restricted).

Solution Overview

The solution leverages advanced AI models and algorithms for real-time video analytics, deployable either on-premises or in the cloud. It processes live camera feeds to detect, identify, and track individuals, generating notifications for entry, exit, and specific zone interactions. The system supports any camera available on the network and can be attached to the processing device itself, running on application-specific or generic hardware.

To enhance accuracy and provide precise location tracking, the system employs multiple cameras already installed across the premises. By correlating feeds from these cameras, it can pinpoint the exact location of employees and track their movement throughout the facility. This multi-camera strategy ensures seamless coverage, reduces blind spots, and provides a comprehensive view of activities across large or complex sites.

A full-stack web application provides a user-friendly dashboard for configuring sites, defining rules for access, attendance, and trespassing zones (buffer, attendance, restricted). This dashboard also manages user profiles, allows for adding new employees, and provides access to logs and analytics, including entry/exit times, total time spent, and activity summaries. The system maintains historical tracking data for unknown persons, including entry frequency and duration of stay, enhancing security intelligence.

Outcomes and Impact

  • Real-time detection and identification of individuals entering premises.
  • Automated attendance marking upon entry and exit, reducing administrative burden.
  • Instant alerts for unauthorized access or trespassing in restricted zones.
  • Historical tracking data for unknown persons, including entry times and durations.
  • Configurable zones enabling flexible application for access control, attendance, and security.
  • Generation of insights such as break times and total time spent in the office.
  • Enhanced security posture through proactive monitoring and immediate incident notification.
  • Improved operational efficiency by automating manual surveillance and attendance processes.

news_blogs_and_event.title: What’s New at Gigantech
news_blogs_and_event.description: We love reading, researching, and writing a lot of stuff about technology, current trends, and other technology-related things. Explore our writings where we have shared our technological insights.

news_items.title: Using Strapi Data Without Running the Backend (Next.js + Static Export)
news_items.author: Fawad Ahmad
news_items.content:
When building with Strapi and Next.js, you usually fetch content from the Strapi backend using API calls. That works great — but what if you don't want to keep the Strapi server running all the time?

This was the exact situation I faced. I needed my Next.js frontend to work with the same Strapi content, but without making live API requests.

## The Challenge

I wanted my website to load content even when the Strapi backend was **not running**. That meant I needed a way to:

- Export all Strapi content (collections, single types, etc.)
- Save related media files (images, uploads)
- Use this exported data in my frontend instead of calling the Strapi API

## The Solution

With the help of ChatGPT, I wrote a small **export script** inside my Strapi project:

*backend/src/scripts/export-content.js*

Run using:
node export-content.js

The script does two things:
1. Exports all Strapi data into JSON files inside:
*frontend/public/content-export/*

2. Copies all media files into:
*frontend/public/content-export/uploads*


## Using Static Data in Next.js

Instead of fetching from the Strapi API, I updated my frontend helper:

*frontend/src/lib/api.js*

The fetchStrapiData() function was modified to read from the exported JSON files. Now, the website loads data instantly without hitting the backend.

## Why This Is Useful

- No need to run Strapi in production if content doesn't change often

- Faster load times (static files served directly)

- Great for hosting on platforms like Vercel or Netlify

- Still flexible: you can re-run the export script anytime content updates

## Final Thoughts
This approach gave me the best of both worlds:

- A powerful CMS (Strapi) for content management
- A fast, static frontend (Next.js) for deployment

If you’re using Strapi + Next.js and want to avoid running the backend all the time, this method is simple and effective. Just export, save, and serve your content as static JSON. 🚀
news_items.description: Learn how to use Strapi content in a Next.js app without running the backend. Export data and media as static files for faster, simpler deployments.

news_items.title: Which LLM Really Handles Complex 3D Coding? A Stress Test You Won’t See in Demos
news_items.author: Dr Mukhtiar Ahmad
news_items.content:
I gave GPT-5, Claude Sonnet 4, Gemini Flash 2.5, DeepSeek DeepThink (R1), and Amazon Kiro the same complex coding task: a 3D neural network simulation in Three.js. Only one model came close to production-level quality.


##  Why I Ran This Experiment
Most LLM reviews show simple tasks: “write a landing page” or “generate a Python script.” But those don’t really tell us how these models behave under **real production-like complexity.**
*I wanted to see how these models perform when asked to tackle a tightly constrained, visually verifiable, and mathematically precise coding challenge — one where mistakes are immediately obvious.*
So I wrote a **prompt about 1,500 tokens long,** spelling out every requirement of a **3D neural network visualization in Three.js.**
![Dashboard](/blogs-images/3d-coding-challenge.png)

The article below includes only a structured summary of those requirements (for readability). But make no mistake: the actual spec was meticulous, covering exact math formulas, timing phases, firing rules, and strict boundary enforcement.
## The Benchmark Problem

### Task (summary of original prompt):

Create a professional 3D neural network visualization using **Three.js** that demonstrates dynamic shape morphing, neural activity simulation, interactive camera controls, and perfect geometric containment of all neural elements.

---

## Highlights of the Requirements

### 🔹 Shapes & Morphing
- Cycle through 5 shapes in strict order: **Sphere → Cone → Cube → Pyramid → Cylinder**  
- Smooth morphing transitions, infinite loop  

### 🔹 Neurons & Connections
- Exactly **1,200 neurons** (white wireframe spheres)  
- At least **3 connections per neuron**, proximity-based  
- **Zero tolerance** for neurons or links outside the shape boundary  

### 🔹 Activity Simulation
- Random neurons fire every **150ms (~1.5%)**
- Red “meteor effect” travels along links.
- Destination neuron glows red and scales 3x for 800ms, then resets.
### 🔹Camera & Interaction
- Interactive rotation with mouse; gentle auto-rotation fallback.
- Cinematic zoom-in (3s) and zoom-out (3s), synced with morph transitions.
- Smooth easing, no jerky movements.

### 🔹Performance
- 60fps target.
- Memory-efficient cleanup of effects.
- Responsive resizing.
- Single HTML file with Three.js via CDN.

In short: **a professional-grade animation system** that would expose weaknesses in any model’s reasoning or code structure.

## The Test Setup

I tested five LLMs:

- **Chat interfaces:** GPT-5, Claude Sonnet 4, Gemini Flash 2.5, DeepSeek DeepThink (R1)  
- **Software development environment:** Amazon Kiro  

Every model received the same requirements. I evaluated them on **accuracy, containment, animation quality, and refinement potential**.

---

## Results by Model

### GPT-5 (Chat UI)

GPT-5 generated workable code, but with serious issues:

- Neurons consistently **leaked outside shape boundaries**.  
- Connections were extended incorrectly.  
- Neuron firing lacked polish and synchronization.  
- Even with multiple refinement prompts, shapes stayed messy.  

Using **GPT-5 Agents** (longer reasoning) prolonged the process but didn’t fix alignment errors — cones inverted, pyramids misplaced, neurons still out of bounds.

**Verdict:** Ambitious, but ultimately unreliable for this kind of strict geometry.

### Claude Sonnet 4 (Chat UI)

Claude performed better than GPT-5:

- More structured output and closer adherence to requirements.  
- Shapes looked cleaner, firing slightly more naturally.  

But…

- Neurons still escaped boundaries.  
- Links didn’t always update correctly.  
- After 5–7 refinement prompts, things improved, but never reached spec.  

**Verdict:** Better discipline than GPT-5, but still not production-ready.  

---

### Gemini Flash 2.5 (Chat UI)

When given the prompt, Gemini replied with:

*I am unable to generate a complete and functional HTML file with the complex Three.js code you’ve requested. My capabilities are limited to providing information and generating text or images, and I cannot create a fully-coded, executable web page.*

**Verdict:** Refreshingly honest, but ultimately a non-result for this test.
### DeepSeek DeepThink (R1) (Chat UI)

Marketed as a “thinking” model, DeepSeek showed the same execution gaps as GPT and Claude:

- Out-of-bounds neurons.  
- Misaligned links.  
- Firing animations lacked precision.
  
Reasoning ability didn’t translate into technical correctness here.  

**Verdict:** Same flaws, different branding.  

---

### Amazon Kiro (Software Dev Environment)

This was the surprise.  

Unlike the chat UIs, Kiro didn’t just dump code. It followed a structured development workflow:

1. Converted my long prompt into a Markdown requirements doc.  
2. Translated that into a design specification.  
3. Broke it down into a task list.  
4. Then generated the implementation.  

The first attempt missed a few requirements. But when I asked:  

> Are you sure you implemented all the requirements?  

Kiro did something no other model did:  

- It checked its work against the requirements list.  
- Found the gaps.  
- Fixed them in the next iteration with a single prompt.  

The final result hit about **95% of the full spec**.  

**Verdict:** The only LLM-based system in this test that was able to implement all the requirements correctly.  
## Final Rankings  

🥇 **Amazon Kiro** → Clear winner. Met nearly all requirements with minimal prompting.  
🥈 **Claude Sonnet 4.0** → Strong attempt, but too much manual refinement needed.  
🥉 **GPT-5** → Ambitious but messy and inconsistent.  
🎭 **DeepSeek Think (R1)** → Same flaws as GPT/Claude, despite “reasoning” claims.  
🚫 **Gemini Flash 2.5** → Did not attempt implementation.  

---

## Takeaways  

1. **Long, detailed prompts expose model weaknesses.**  
   The 1,500-token spec I provided was deliberately precise, and most models struggled to stay within those constraints.  

2. **Chat UIs aren’t enough for production-level tasks.**  
   GPT, Claude, DeepSeek, and Gemini behaved like “helpers.” They don’t enforce discipline unless you spoon-feed corrections for hours.  

3. **Requirement verification is the difference-maker.**  
   Amazon Kiro stood out because it didn’t just generate code — it cross-checked requirements, found gaps, and corrected them. That’s what made it succeed where others failed.  

---

## Closing Thoughts  

This experiment convinced me of something bigger:  

Future LLMs won’t just be about being “smarter.” They’ll need to adopt structured engineering workflows — breaking problems down, checking against specs, and iterating systematically.  

Because in real-world coding, intelligence without verification isn’t enough.  

And for now, **Kiro is the only LLM-based system I’ve tested that was able to implement all the requirements correctly.**  

---

**Note:** Some of the content is AI-generated.
news_items.description: Testing GPT-5, Claude Sonnet 4, Gemini Flash 2.5, DeepSeek R1, and Amazon Kiro on a complex 3D neural network task in Three.js—only Kiro delivered production-ready results.

news_items.title: Document Processing: Experience and Learnings
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
## 🧪 Project Overview

![quattro research logo](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Logo_placeholder_image.png/600px-Logo_placeholder_image.png)

Founded in **2004**, **quattro research** develops intuitive software that empowers digital scientific workflows. Their **Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS)** — such as **quattro/CM**, **quattro/LJ**, and **quattro/BR** — manage and analyze complex chemical and biological data.

---

![Team Collaboration](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1632179002215-f5c8d5dcf35b)

To scale quickly and meet growing client demand, quattro research partnered with **unicrew** to strengthen their engineering team with skilled developers who could integrate seamlessly and boost project velocity.

---

## 🚧 Key Challenges

![Challenges](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1573164713347-df1e1f69a3f2)

- **Scalability Requirements** – Needed to scale fast without lowering code quality.
- **Complex UI Needs** – Required a responsive UI for large molecular datasets.
- **Scientific Data Presentation** – Flexible visualization in dynamic grids and forms.
- **Modern Security Protocols** – Needed secure access management (OAuth, JWT).
- **High-Performance Rendering** – For complex molecule structure visualization.

---

## ✅ Solution

### 🔹 React-Based UI

![React UI](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1581091012184-5c2bca6f3bb6)

Designed and implemented a performant, intuitive React frontend for handling complex molecule data structures.

---

### 🔹 Configurable Data Framework

![Grid System](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1645051915681-183d5f30ef0a)

Developed a flexible framework allowing scientists to customize data views using dynamic **grids** and **forms**.

---

### 🔹 Secure Authentication

![Security](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:720/format:webp/0*PRZcNPDVe2z5n7kO)

Integrated **OAuth** and **JWT** for robust and modern authentication & authorization standards.

---

### 🔹 Molecule Visualization

![Molecule Viewer](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fit:720/format:webp/0*PRZcNPDVe2z5n7kO)

Delivered advanced visualization tools for rendering large and complex molecule structures efficiently.

---

## 👥 Collaboration Snapshot

![Unicrew Team](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1581091870622-df42a3f9808b)

**unicrew** assembled a full-stack development team with expertise in:
- `.NET`, `Java`, `PHP`, `Laravel`
- `JavaScript`, `React`, `Vue`

They worked in **agile sprints** alongside quattro research’s internal team to maintain alignment, speed, and flexibility.

---

## 🎯 Results

![Success](https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1581093588401-99a6f43db2a9)

- **⚡ Faster Development** – Accelerated product delivery timelines.
- **🎨 Better Usability** – UI tailored for scientific users.
- **🔐 Improved Security** – OAuth and JWT integration.
- **🔬 Enhanced Visualization** – Clarity in molecule data exploration.
- **🤝 Ongoing Partnership** – Sustained collaboration with quattro research.

---

> _"unicrew's developers integrated seamlessly with our team, demonstrating professionalism and a deep understanding of our needs. Their contributions have been invaluable."_  
> — **Dr. Bernhard Schirm**, Managing Director

[🔗 View Full Review](https://example.com/review)

---

## 🛠 Related Services

- ✅ Dedicated Software Development Teams  
- ✅ White Label Web Development  
- ✅ Legacy Software Modernization
news_items.description: Is Android 15 released?  Various developer previews and beta versions of Android 15 have been released so far.

news_items.title: BLA delivers quality according to world standards
news_items.author: John Smith
news_items.content:
## What’s new with Android 15?
Android 15 introduces enhanced privacy controls, new APIs for better performance and user experience, and advanced camera features like **Low Light Boost**. It also deprecates older technologies like **WebSQL**, making way for more modern solutions like **IndexedDB**.
## Is Android 15 released?
Various developer previews and beta versions of Android 15 have been released so far. The final launch is expected to occur sometime in the **fall of 2024**.

## How does Android 15 address app compatibility and backward compatibility issues?
Android 15 includes several measures to ensure app compatibility and backward compatibility, such as:
- Detailed documentation on behavior changes
- New feature support
- Tools like the **Android Compatibility Test Suite (CTS)**

These ensure that apps remain functional and performant on the new platform while still supporting older versions where necessary.

## What are the benefits of the improved camera APIs in Android 15 for app developers?
The improved camera APIs provide:
- Greater control over camera hardware
- Real-time effects
- Improved HDR processing
- Better integration with machine learning algorithms

These capabilities help developers create advanced camera experiences like:

- Augmented reality applications
- Advanced photo/video editing features
## How does Android 15 improve app performance on older devices?
Android 15 offers:
- Optimized memory management
- Enhanced rendering pipelines

These improvements ensure apps run smoothly even on devices with limited hardware resources.

---

## References

- [First Android 15 Developer Preview](https://android-developers.googleblog.com/2024/02/first-developer-preview-android15.html)
- [Android 15 Features Overview](https://developer.android.com/about/versions/15/features)
- [Android Developers Blog](https://android-developers.googleblog.com)
- [Android Developers Official Site](https://developer.android.com)
news_items.description: ISTQB (International Software Testing Qualifications Board) is a globally recognized organization that provides standardized certifications for software testers.

news_items.title: Parsing Excel Files at Scale with Docling
news_items.author: Muhammad Hashir Saikhani
news_items.content:
## Executive Summary

Excel is one of the most widely used tools for managing and sharing data. Yet, extracting structured and meaningful information from `.xlsx` files is often harder than it seems. Our team set out to find a solution that could reliably parse **tables and text together**, maintain **context and formatting**, and work without relying on **paid APIs or external services**.  

After exploring several libraries and approaches, we discovered **Docling**, a solution that balanced flexibility, scalability, and reliability, making it the best fit for our needs.

---

![Excel to Structured Output](general.png)

---

## Challenges

At first glance, parsing Excel sounds straightforward. But when we started working with real-world files, we quickly ran into roadblocks:

- **Different table types**: Some files used native Excel tables, while others had only simple tabular ranges. Most tools could handle one type but not both.  
- **Context loss**: In many cases, tables were surrounded by important explanatory text. Traditional libraries ignored this, leaving us with incomplete data.  
- **Table boundaries**: Detecting where a table started and ended became tricky, especially when multiple tables existed in the same sheet.  
- **Maintenance burden**: The more logic we added to patch gaps in existing libraries, the more brittle and complex the system became.  
- **Scalability issues**: Our solution had to process thousands of files, not just a handful. Performance and reliability mattered.  

These challenges motivated us to step back and rethink our approach.

---

## Motivation

Our motivation was simple but clear:  

We wanted to build a **robust, free, and local-first tool** that could parse Excel files while **retaining both tables and context**. Specifically, the tool needed to:  

- Parse **native tables** as well as **simple tabular ranges**.  
- Extract **tables together with text**, not in isolation.  
- Preserve **formatting and relationships** between data and notes.  
- Append **text alongside tables** when needed for clarity.  
- Avoid dependency on **paid APIs** or complex external setups.  

This vision kept us grounded as we experimented with different methods.

---

##  Methods We Tried

### 1. **Pandas**
- **Pros:**
  - Widely known and very easy to use.
  - Great for loading simple tables into DataFrames.  
- **Cons:**
  - Could not detect **native Excel tables**.
  - Required heavy **custom table-boundary logic**.
  - Failed to capture surrounding context.  

**Verdict:** Solid for basic jobs but not enough for complex parsing.

---

### 2. **OpenPyXL**
- **Pros:**
  - Reads **native Excel tables** and cell text.  
- **Cons:**
  - Missed **simple tabular ranges**.  
  - Still demanded extra parsing logic to unify outputs.  

**Verdict:** A step up from Pandas, but still incomplete.

---

### 3. **LlamaIndex**
- **Pros:**
  - Provides an **end-to-end pipeline**: parsing + querying.  
- **Cons:**
  - Required **two API keys** (Llama Parse + OpenAI).  
  - Depended on **paid APIs**, against our free/local requirement.  

**Verdict:** Too costly and external for our workflow.

---

### 4. **Marker**
- **Pros:**
  - Offered both **LLM-powered** and **non-LLM** modes.  
  - The LLM version delivered impressive parsing results.  
- **Cons:**
  - LLM mode consumed **too many OpenAI tokens**, driving up costs.  
  - Non-LLM mode often **hallucinated tags** and produced errors.  
  - Required significant **post-processing**.  

**Verdict:** Interesting experiment, but unstable and costly.

---

### 5. **Docling (Final Choice)**
- **Pros:**
  - Strong parsing engine capable of handling **tables + text**.  
  - Multiple export options: **Dict, HTML, Text, Element Nodes**, and more.  
  - Local-first, no reliance on external APIs.  
- **Cons:**
  - Export formats each had small quirks.  
- **Solution:**
  - We standardized on the **`dict` export** for flexibility.  
  - Added custom logic to handle quirks and standardize outputs.  

**Verdict:** Flexible, scalable, and powerful enough for production.

---

## Example Applications

Docling can be applied in real-world scenarios such as:  

- **Financial reporting**: Parsing monthly Excel reports into structured data for automated dashboards.  
- **Survey analysis**: Extracting tabular responses along with explanatory notes for research insights.  
- **Operational logs**: Capturing tables from Excel logs while retaining context from comments and footnotes.  
- **Data migration**: Converting legacy Excel-based datasets into standardized formats for new systems.  
- **Compliance audits**: Extracting both tables and supporting text from Excel-based audit reports for validation.  

---

## Business Impact

Switching to Docling delivered clear results:  

- **50–70% reduction in engineering effort**: Developers no longer needed to maintain complex parsing logic.  
- **Higher accuracy**: Tables and surrounding notes were consistently extracted, reducing manual corrections.  
- **Cost savings**: Avoiding paid APIs removed recurring expenses.  
- **Significant time savings**: For example, processing a batch of 500 Excel reports that previously required multiple analysts now takes a few hours on a single machine.  
- **Improved decision-making**: Teams gained quicker access to accurate, structured data for reporting and analysis.  

---

## Performance Results

We also measured Docling’s performance against our needs:  

**Test Case 1 – Cell values as strings**  
![Performance Results 1](/blogs-images/excel-blog-performance1.png)

**Test Case 2 – Cell values as floats**  
![Performance Results 2](/blogs-images/excel-blog-performance2.png)

---

## Conclusion

Parsing Excel at scale is harder than it looks, most tools solve one piece of the puzzle but fall short elsewhere. Through trial and error, we found **Docling** to be the most **complete and reliable solution**, balancing accuracy, scalability, and flexibility.  

By adopting Docling, organizations can **streamline their data workflows, reduce costs, and unlock more value** from Excel-based information at scale.
news_items.description: How we solved the challenges of parsing complex Excel files at scale and why Docling proved to be the most reliable and scalable solution.
